definition: tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes

sentences.english: Tensions are not confined to North-East Asia.
sentences.chinese: 紧张状态并不局限在东北亚地区。

sentences.english: When a person is running they are putting their body under stress.
sentences.chinese: 当人们奔跑时，他们的肌体便处于紧张状态。
它是创造性的紧张状态。

sentences.english: The tension in that story builds up toward a climax.
sentences.chinese: 那个故事的紧张状态逐步发展到了高潮。

sentences.english: It was at the most intense point of this preoccupation that Enjolras accosted him.
sentences.chinese: 当安灼拉走来找他时，他正处在这种紧张状态的顶点。

sentences.english: It can also ease the tension among colleagues and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 它可以缓解同事之间和邻居之间的紧张状态。

sentences.english: In the supinated position, the medial ankle structures are not under tension.
sentences.chinese: 在旋后状态下，踝关节内侧结构不处于紧张状态。

sentences.english: It was against this backdrop of racial tension that the civil war began.
sentences.chinese: 这场内战肇端于种族之间的紧张状态。

sentences.english: I've never experienced such a high tension and concentration before.
sentences.chinese: 我之前从来没有感受到如此好的紧张状态和集中力。

sentences.english: Otherwise these kinds of tensions can spiral out of control.
sentences.chinese: 否则，这类的紧张状态会发展到直至失控。

sentences.english: The tension between the two countries built up to a climax.
sentences.chinese: 两国间的紧张状态渐渐达到了顶峰。

definition: to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
to be in (some state, position, or condition)
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to bring relief/to alleviate (a crisis)/to dull (a pain)
to be situated at/to find oneself at
